title: Really Easy Baked Sole Fish With Mozzarella And Tomato
summary: Really Easy Baked Sole Fish With Mozzarellan And Tomato might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 1 and costs $21.18 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 151g of protein, 55g of fat, and a total of 1172 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian diet. A mixture of tomato, oregano, salt and pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 25 minutes. Overall, this recipe earns a good spoonacular score of 66%. Similar recipes include Really Easy Baked Sole Fish With Mozzarellan and Tomato, Easy Pan Fried Sole Fish With Lemon-Butter Sauce, and Easy Tomato Mozzarella Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Rabble Pinot Gris with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Set oven to 375 degrees.Butter (do not use cooking spray) a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.Rinse fish fillets with cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.Arrange fillets in a single layer in dish.Sprinkle with shredded mozza cheese.Top with tomato slices.Sprinkle seasonings over top.Bake for 15 minutes, or until fish is "flakey" and cooked (do not over bake fis).Serve immediately.

steps.step: Set oven to 375 degrees.Butter (do not use cooking spray) a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.Rinse fish fillets with cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.Arrange fillets in a single layer in dish.
Sprinkle with shredded mozza cheese.Top with tomato slices.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until fish is "flakey" and cooked (do not over bake fis).
